title: Homemade Chicken Nuggets Recipe
description: These chicken nuggets get extra flavor from a crispy herb-and-Parmesan crust. They're not just for kids! Serve with your favorite dipping sauces.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Meat and Poultry Chicken Baked and Roasted Oven Fried Homemade Chicken Nuggets 4.5 (1,896) 1,298 Reviews 114 Photos Chicken nuggets are a real kid-pleaser! Adults will enjoy this recipe for a tasty appetizer, too! Serve warm, with your favorite dipping sauces if desired. Submitted by Teresa C. Rouzer Updated on January 2, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 114 114 114 114 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts 1 cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese 1 tablespoon dried basil 1 teaspoon dried thyme 1 teaspoon salt ½ cup butter, melted Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cut chicken breasts into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix the bread crumbs, Parmesan, basil, thyme, and salt together well in a medium bowl. Put melted butter in a bowl or dish for dipping. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Dip chicken pieces into the melted butter first, then coat with the bread crumb mixture. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place the well-coated chicken nuggets on a lightly greased cookie sheet in a single layer. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake nuggets in the preheated oven until browned and chicken is cooked through, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,823 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 308 Calories 19g Fat 15g Carbs 19g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 308 % Daily Value * Total Fat 19g 24% Saturated Fat 11g 57% Cholesterol 81mg 27% Sodium 989mg 43% Total Carbohydrate 15g 5% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 1g Protein 19g 39% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 142mg 11% Iron 2mg 12% Potassium 237mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Homemade Chicken Nuggets 01 of 114 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 114 Photo by  PlumPasta1973 02/01/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Delicious. Very tender. Will be making again. 03 of 114 Photo by  Lisa Powell 09/24/2023 Nothing like a home cooked meal. delicious! Thank you 04 of 114 Photo by  carreenie 05/16/2023 Absolutely delicious! I skipped the salt and did half plain and half italian bread crumbs. Even my picky kid liked them. 05 of 114 Photo by  Alexis 09/03/2022 Followed the recipe to a T. Best, chicken, ever! Both of my young kids ate every bite! 06 of 114 Photo by  Beth 12/28/2020 For bread crumbs, I used 3 day old homemade bread. Works great when finely chopped. Great for snacking, with or without a dipping sauce, while playing a friendly game of Chess.... 07 of 114 Photo by  Amelia Marchant Hall 10/29/2020 08 of 114 Photo by  Adam Henley 09/21/2020 It’s a great recipe! However no matter how long I was baking it, I couldn’t get a nice browning on the outside. After that I heated them in a pan with vegetable oil for two minutes each such and that helped a lot with the color and texture! 09 of 114 Photo by  Adam Henley 09/21/2020 It’s a great recipe! However no matter how long I was baking it, I couldn’t get a nice browning on the outside. After that I heated them in a pan with vegetable oil for two minutes each such and that helped a lot with the color and texture! 10 of 114 Photo by  Miranda Kirsop 05/22/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Buffalo Chicken Fingers 613 Ratings Herbed Chicken Nuggets 297 Ratings Spicy Baked Picnic Chicken 8 Ratings Crixxie's Ranch Chicken Nuggets 74 Ratings Amazing Crusted Chicken 333 Ratings Best and Easiest Chicken Nuggets 86 Ratings Parmesan-Garlic Keto Chicken Wings 3 Ratings Asparagus and Mozzarella Stuffed Chicken Breasts 532 Ratings Sheet Pan Dinner with Chicken and Veggies 37 Ratings Three-Ingredient Baked Chicken Breasts 435 Ratings Keto Baked Spinach-Artichoke Chicken Breasts 2 Ratings Gluten-Free Shake and Bake Almond Chicken 66 Ratings Pesto-Stuffed Chicken Breast 22 Ratings Balsamic-Glazed Stuffed Chicken Breasts with Pesto and Parmesan 4 Ratings Oven Fried Chicken III 1,141 Ratings Panko Buffalo Chicken Tenders 6 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
